conclusion: Analyze the motion of the charged particle in the magnetic field to determine magnetic induction B.
Particle is injected from point c with velocity v0 at an angle of 45 degrees to MN.
Velocity components are v0x = v0/sqrt(2) and v0y = v0/sqrt(2).
Particle collides with insulating plate ab and reverses horizontal velocity component while maintaining vertical component.
After collision, velocity components are vx = -v0/sqrt(2) and vy = v0/sqrt(2).
Particle moves in a circular path due to the magnetic field.
Radius R of circular path is given by R = mv/qB.
Particle must travel a distance of 2d horizontally to reach point f from collision point on the plate.
Horizontal distance covered in one half-circle is pi R.
Since particle travels 2d horizontally, pi R = 2d.
Solving for R, we get R = 2d/pi.
Speed of particle after collision is still v0 because magnitude of velocity components remains the same.
Using radius formula R = mv0/qB, substitute R = 2d/pi.
Solving for B, we get B = pi mv0/(2qd).
Magnitude of magnetic induction B is pi mv0/(2qd).
